dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A six-year-old girl sits watching the show intently. This is OLIVE. She is big for her age and slightly plump. She has frizzy hair and wears black-rimmed glasses. She studies the show very earnestly. Then, using a remote, she FREEZES the image. Absently, she holds up one hand and mimics the waving sty of Miss America. She REWINDS the tape and starts all over Again, Miss America hears her name announced, and once ag breaks down in tears -- overwhelmed and triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There’s two kinds of people in this world -- Winners...and Losers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD (45) stands at the front of a generic community college classroom -~ cinderblock walls, industrial carpet He wears pleated khaki shorts, a golf shirt, sneakers. He moves with the stocky, stiff-legged gait of a former athl His peppy, upbeat demeanor just barely masks a seething s of insecurity and frustration. MUSIC continues underneath

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: If there’s one thing you take away from the nine weeks we've spent, it should be this: Winners and Losers. What's the difference? Richard turns with a remote and clicks through a Power Po presentation, projected on the wall behind him. The slides mimic Darwin’s “Evolution of Man” chart, exce that they show a lumpy, hunched-over, sad-sack “Loser” ev into a smiling, triumphant, arms-over-his~head “Winner” . Winners see what they want, they go out and they get it, They don’t hesitate. They don't make excuses. And they don't give up. Losers don’t get what they want. They hesitate. They make excuses. And they give up. on themselves and their dreams. Richard puts down his remote for the big finale. In the d half-light, Bees a hushed, dramatic moment. RICHARD (cont'd) Inside each of you -- at the very core of your being -- ig a Winner waiting to be awakened... and unleashed upon the world. With my nine step “Unleash the Winner Inside” program, you now have the tools, the know-how, the insights you need to put your losing habits behind you and make your dreams come true. No hesitating! No excuses! TI want you to go out into the world...and be Winners: . Big smile. REVERSE ANGLE -~ There are twenty STUDENTS in a classroom that could seat two hundred. They CLAP half-heartedly, Then there’s an awkward moment when everyone gathers thei stuff. No one Says anything. Chairs SCRAPE the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ++Yeah, I’m on my way now. INT. CAR - pay A woman, SHERYL, 40s, is smoking and talking on a cell ph as she weaves through a strip-mall landscape. She wears office attire and a name tag that reads, “Sheryl”.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: -+I don’t know how long... don’t know... 1 Richard, he doesn’t have anywhere else to go! She takes a drag, listens with increasing irritation, the exhales. A beat.  SHERYL (cont’ d) I’m not smoking... I’m not! Look, I'm at the hospital... (beat) Yeah, I'll pick up a bucket of chicken. Okay, bye, She beeps off her Phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl strides anxiously down a hospital corridor, finger eross on her necklace, going from one room to another, ch numbers. She finds the room she’s looking for, As she tries to enter, a DOCTOR emerges. They nearly coll

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Ms. Harvey? (Sheryl nods) Your brother's fine... Sheryl exhales, hugely relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ina wheelchair, Parked against a wall, is Sheryl’s brothe FRANK, also middle-ayed. His wrists are wrapped in bandag With empty eyes, he listens to the muted VOICE of the Doc coming from the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (O.8.)
dialogues.text: +..Keep him away from sharp objects: knives, scissors... If you have medications —~ depressants -- in your house, keep them secured. “ INT. HOSPITAL CORRIDOR - Day Sheryl listens to the Doctor,

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I‘d prefer to keep him, but.. 5

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: I know, the insurance... She shakes her head and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You want to see him, ode  INT. HOSPITAL ROOM ~- Day Sheryl and the Doctor enter. Frank barely reacts.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Hey, Frank...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sheryl. Fighting tears, she goes and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: I’m so glad you're still here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well. That’s one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hands spill a brown powder onto a small mirror. A razor blade cuts the powder into lines. A rolled-up dollar bill lowers. ‘The lines are snorted, The snorter lifts his heaq up. Heisa short, chunky, balding old man -~ a Roz Chast kind of grandfather, This is GRANDPA, 80 years old, INT. DWAYNE’S BEDROOM - Day DWAYNE is a handsome, skinny fifteen year old with a moha He lies on his back in his bedroom, bench-pressing a barb JUMP CUTS; Dwayne does vertical sit-ups on a wall-mounted brace, Dwayne does vertical push-ups leaning against the wall, Dwayne breathes heavily, having finished his work-out. He walks to a home-made calender on the wall made from a roll of computer paper, It is marked, “Enlistment,” On the roll is a long grid of maybe a thousand squares. About half the squares have been filled in with magic mar Dwayne uncaps a magic marker and fills in one more squar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl drives Frank home from the hospital. They say nothing. Sheryl sneaks glances at Frank. Hesitantly:

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: You want to talk? Or no? Frank stares at the road in front of them. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay. She nods. They keep driving.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: TITLE: “LITTLE MISS SUNSHINE” MUSIC ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty kitchen. A phone and answering machine sit in th FOREGROUND. The message light is BLINKING. In the background, through a doorway, the front door open Sheryl and Frank enter Carrying several bags and suitcase

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hello! Anyone,...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads Frank down a hallway. He follows Passively.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Down here. We have you with Dwayne. She knocks and pushes Open the door to Dwayne’s room. Dwa is on the bed, reading THUS SPOKE ZARATHUSTRA, He sits up

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Dwayne? Hi, Uncle Frank’s here. Frank hesitates. He gives Sheryl a look: “You’re kidding. SHERYL (cont’d) He doesn’t mind, Frank. We talked. Frank makes a half-gesture towards the rest of the house SHERYL (cont’d) We can’t have you sleeping alone. The doctors said... {he looks at her) I’m sorry. I have to insist. Dwayne gets up and exits the room, pushing past them and avoiding eye contact. Sheryl enters the bedroom. INT. DWAYNE’S BEDROOM - DAY Sheryl goes and brushes off a cot. Frank remains outside.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: You'll get along fine. He’s really quiet. Look, I set up a cot. {he hesitates) Please, Frank? Please? Very unhappily, Frank enters the room and just stands the SHERYL (cont’d) Thank you. I gotta start dinner. Come out when you’re settled? And leave the door open. That's important. (beat). I’m glad you’re here. ‘she gives him a kiss on the cheek, then departs. Frank sits on the cot in his nephew’s bedroom. On it is a Muppet sleeping bag with the Cookie Monster eating a cook Frank glances at the sleeping bag, then averts his eyes. This is pretty much the worst moment of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne is at the dinner table, reading. Sheryl walks by.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Dwayne, honey, there’s a bucket of chicken in the car. Can you get it and I‘1l make a salad? Dwayne silently gets up and departs, and the chaotic ball of dinner preparations in the Harvey household begins. Sheryl opens the door to the downstairs rec room and shou SHERYL (cont‘d) Olive?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Is Grandpa with you?!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing? OLIVE (0.s.) Rehearsing!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay! Dinner in ten minutes!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Okay! INT. KITCHEN - Day Sheryl enters, opens the refridgerator, and begins pullin out stuff to make a salad, Abruptly, from the kitchen side door, Richard enters,

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Ha

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Hi. Frank’s here,

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Oh. Did Stan Grossman call?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Check the machine. He walks over and hits the answering machine,

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE
dialogues.text: Hello. you have one message. It rewinds, Dwayne enters holding a bucket of KFC,

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Just put it on the table, hon. and can you set the table? We'll do Paper plates tonight. 1r/11 get cups and napkins. Dwayne nods and departs. Sheryl exits in the other direction. The phone message begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Sheryl, hey, it's Jeff. Listen, great news. You know, when Olive was down here last month, she was runner up in the regional Little Miss Sunshine...?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (calling to Sheryl) It’s from Jeff. (to himself) Fuck! He stalks off. The MESSAGE plays to the empty kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) ...Well, they just called me and said that the girl who won had to forfeit her crown. I don't know why -- something about diet pills -- but anyway, that means Olive won the regionals, so now she has a place in the State contest in Boca. They want to make sure she can make it, so I said you'd call them... Sheryl re-enters. She tries to listen to Jeff's message. JEFF (cont’d) (0.C.) (filtered) ...The woman's name is Lauren Henderson and her number... BEEEEP. ‘The machine cuts him off. Sheryl, not understand shakes her head and returns to making her salad. Richard enters, picks up the phone and dials. Over the following, comes in and out, picking up stuff to set the table.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (into phone) Richard Harvey for Stan Grossman. Can you reach him...?! Yeah, tell him I want to know this thing is done -- I’m waiting for the numbers. No, I understand that. I understand. Look, he has my cell, if he could just call me anytime over the weekend and let me know we're on, I'd be very, very grateful. Okay. Thank you. Bye. He hangs up.  RICHARD (cont’d) Bitch.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard...! So what happened with Stan Grossman?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He’s still in Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: So why hasn’t he called you?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Will you let me worry about this?! Sheryl exhales, goes back to her salad. Dwayne comes in.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Dwayne, can you check on Frank? Tell him it’s dinner time. Dwayne nods and heads off. Sheryl walks back to the door the downstairs rec room and opens it again. SHERYL (cont’d) Olive?! Dinner time!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay! : INT. DWAYNE’S BEDROOM - DAY Frank sits on the cot, staring at a photo in his wallet ( see it). FOOTSTEPS approach. Frank puts the photo away. Dwayne appears in the door, knocks, and mimes eating.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Dinner? (Dwayne nods) What? You don’t talk anymore? (Dwayne shakes his head) Why not? Dwayne rolls his eyes and half-shrugs. FRANK (cont‘’d) You can talk. You just choose not to? Then he points to the bed-sheet painting of Dwayne nods. Frank turns and looks. Nietzsche hanging on his wall.  iu. PRANK (cont'd) Is that Nietzsche? You don’t speak because of Friedrich Nietzsche? Dwayne nods, turns and leaves. Frank considers this. FRANK (cont’d) Far out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne sits in his chair, folds his arms, and -- scowling for everyone else to arrive. Frank tentatively follows. S comes out and puts her salad on the table.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Frank, you can sit here, next to Dwayne. Here’s the salad. I'm gonna run get Sprite for everyone. She walks off, pausing to open the rec room door again. SHERYL (cont’d) Olive! Come on! Dinner time!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Coming!!! Sheryl disappears, leaving Dwayne and Frank alone. Frank sits. Dwayne scowls at the table in front of him. Frank looks at his place setting -- a paper plate and a B Gulp cup with the Incredible Hulk on it. He picks up the and examines it dispassionately. He puts it down. Dwayne doesn’t move. Frank glances at Dwayne, not knowing what to do. He seems to have met someone who is at least unhappy as he is. This intrigues him. He ventures:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Got a girlfriend? Dwayne looks at Frank, then shakes his head. FRANK (cont’d) Boyfriend? Dwayne gives Frank a look. FRANK (cont’d) Kidding. Kidding. I know. (beat) So who do you hang out with?  pled Dwayne shakes his head. FRANK (cont’d) No one? There must be someone. ..! (Dwayne shakes his head) You don’t hang out with anyone? Oh come on. You must have one friend! Dwayne reaches in his back pocket and pulls o pad of paper. He flips it ut a palm-sizeq open and scribbles a note. He shows it to Frank, It reads: ne hate everyone." FRANK (cont’d) What about your family? Dwayne scribbles again. Everyone? He shows it to Frank. Thate everyone!!! He’s underlined "everyone" It now reads: three times. Frank looks at him. FRANK (cont’d) You hate me? Dwayne considers this. He scribbles a new note. It reads: "Not yet.” FRANK (cont’d) Fair enoug! They go back to sitting in silence. Richard comes out.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Frank. Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Richard... They shake, Richard sits down, Silence. Richard stands up.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get Olive. He walks to the downstairs doorway and shouts. RICHARD (cont ‘d) Dad! Olive! Come on! OLIVE (0.s. ) (shrieking) We're coming!!!  Sheryl enters with a big bottle of Diet Sprite.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: You guys, go on and start. Frank, Some Sprite? J want everyone to have at least a little salad.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Thanks, Sheryl. She pours him a cup, sits down, and starts opening contai of cole slaw and mashed potatoes. Richard returns to the table, sits, and grabs a piece of chicken from the bucket. Dwayne follows suit, as does Fra The meal begins. Three seconds of silence. FRANK (cont'd) So, Sheryl... f couldn't help notice Dwayne has stopped speaking.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Oh! I'm Sorry. Dwayne’s taken a vow of silence,

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You’ve taken a vow of silence?! Dwayne nods.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: He’s gonna join the Naval Academy and become a fighter pilot. He's taken a vow of silence until he reaches that goal,

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Dwayne) You're kidding... 1 Dwayne stares at Frank. He’s not kidding. Olive enters th room, with Grandpa following.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Hi, Uncle Frank!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Olive. Boy, you’re gettin’ big! (to Sheryl) Is she big for her age? Sheryl nods, Olive, unprompted, walks over and gives hima kiss on the cheek. She sees the bandages on Frank’s wrist  ae

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: What happened to your arms?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Olive...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No, it’s okay. I had a little accident. I’m okay now.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How’s the new routine coming?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: It’s good.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: When‘re you gonna let us see it?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I dunno. It’s up to Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: A couple of days. It needs a polish. Olive sits. Grandpa walks to the table. . GRANDPA (cont’d) What is this?! Chicken?! Every day it’s the chicken! Holy God almighty! Is it possible, just one time, we could have something for dinner except the goddamn fucking chicken?! Sheryl ignores him. Richard tries to cut him off.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Dad... Dad... Dad... Dad!!!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: I’m just saying...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: If you want to cook or buy your own food, you’re more than welcome...

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Christ. Y'know, at Sunset Village...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: If you liked Sunset Village so much maybe you shouldn’t have gotten yourself kicked out of there...!  ate

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: (waves dismissively) Abbhh...! He takes out a piece of chicken and starts eating. A tens silence. Frank tries to get things going again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: When did you start? With the vow? Dwayne shrugs. He doesn’t care to comment.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It‘s been nine months. He hasn’t said a word. I think it shows tremendous discipline.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m serious! I think we could all learn something from what Dwayne’s doing! Dwayne has a goal. He has a dream. It may not be my dream, or your dream, but still... He’s pursuing that dream with focus and discipline. In fact, I was thinking about the Nine Steps... GRANDPA . Oh, for crying out loud...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (evenly) ...About the Nine Steps, and how Dwayne’s utilizing at least seven of them in his journey to personal fulfillment.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard. Please.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m just saying! I’ve come around! I think Dwayne deserves our support. Frank looks at Dwayne. Dwayne rolls his eyes. Olive addresses Frank.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: How did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How did what happen?  15.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Your accident...

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Honey... She shakes her head: “Don’t go there,”

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. Unless you object...

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: No, I’m pro-honesty here, I just think, you know... It’s up to you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Be my guest...

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Olive, Uncle Frank didn't really have an accident. What happened was: he tried to kill himself.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: You did? Why?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don’t think this is an appropriate conversation. {to Olive) Let's leave Uncle Frank alone. A beat. Olive has stopped eating.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Why did you want to kill yourself?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Frank. Don’t answer that question. Frank stares at Richard. He turns back to Olive,

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I tried to kill myself because I was very unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Don’t listen, honey, he’s Sick and he doesn’t know what he’s...

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard... Richard... - Richard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I don’t think it’s appropriate for a six year old!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: She's gonna find out anyway. Go on, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Why were you unhappy? Frank glances at Richard -~ deadpan victorious -- and continues. .

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well, there were a lot of reasons. Mainly, though, I fell in love with someone who didn’t love me back...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: One of my grad students. I was very much in love with him.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Him? It was a boy? You fell in love with a boy?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Ves) i did. Very much. so. This is new to Olive. She thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: That’s silly.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're right. It was very, very silly.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: There’s another word for it...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: So... That’s when you tried to kill yourself...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no. What happened was: the boy I was in love with fell in love with another man, Larry Sugarman.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Who’s Larry Sugarman?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Larry Sugarman is perhaps the second most highly regarded Proust scholar in the U.S.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Who’s number one?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That would be me, Rich.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: So... That’s when you tried...?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well, no. What happened was: I was a bit upset. I did some things I shouldn’t have done. Subsequently, I was fired, forced to leave my apartment and move into a motel.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Oh. So that’s when...?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Well, no. Actually, all that was okay. What happened was: two days ago the MacArthur Foundation decided to award a “genius” grant to Larry Sugarman. (deep breath) And that’s when...

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: ...You tried to check out early.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yes. And I failed at that as well.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Olive, what’s important to understand is that Uncle Frank gave up on himself. He made a series of foolish choices, and then he gave up on himself, which is something that winners never do.  18. A beat. Frank looks like he could leap across the table a strangle Richard. Sheryl intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: So that’s the story, okay? Let’s move on. Olive, how’s your new routine coming?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Fine. I told you. Over the above, Frank turns and asks, regarding Richard:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is he always like this? (Dwayne nods) How can you stand it? Dwayne writes a note, shows it to Frank. It reads: “T can’t.” Frank nods. Richard addresses Olive.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Honey, tell Frank why you’re doing your dance routine.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Olive. Why are you doing a dance routine?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: For Little Miss Crab-Cakes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (arch) A-ha! Just as I suspected...!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Honey, tell him what Little Miss Crab-Cakes is.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Little Miss Crab-Cakes is a beauty contest for everyone in Maryland. But you have to be six or seven years old and you have to be a girl. Frank looks skeptically at Sheryl.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Don’t look at me! This is Jeff and the new step-Mom. It's big down in Florida. + eR  iy.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Olive) So what do you think your chances are? Olive takes the question like a pro.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I think I can win. ‘Cause a lot of the new girls -- they don’t have the experience.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well, good luck.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s not about luck. Luck is the name that losers give to their own failings. It’s about wanting to win. Willing yourself to win. You got to want it badder than anyone.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I do!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Do you? Really? (a beat; she nods) Then you’re gonna be a winner! She smiles, Dwayne shakes his head and keeps eating.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What?! It’s true!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: T was runner up in Florida!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: When were you in Florida?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Spring break. Jeff had custody for two weeks. Olive made it to the top of the Regionals down there.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I was second place.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Sher, y’know, there’s a message from Jeff on the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Did you hear what it was?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Actually, it was something about Little Miss Sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: What? Little Miss Sunshine? What?! She runs off. Sheryl follows Olive into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl and Olive approach the answering machine. The “message” light is blinking. Sheryl hits it.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Sheryl, hey, it's Jeff£...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, Frank, and Dwayne try to listen, eating silently

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive and Sheryl listen.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) ...Something about diet pills, but anyway that means that Olive won the regionals, so now she has a place in the State contest in Boca... BEEEP. Over the above, Olive reacts with involuntary spas of shock, disbelief, and then pure, unadulterated euphori She waits -- trembling -- to hear the whole message. When ends, she puts her hands to her temples:

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL

dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Dad. oe

dialogues.text: Honey... Honey... Honey... (patient) As soon as I hear from Stan, we’1ll get the advance, I will pay you back, we'll start generating revenue. But in the meantime... Sheryl exhales, grits her teeth, shakes her head.

dialogues.text: In the Miata? How’re you gonna fit Grandpa?

dialogues.text: What ?! I coached her! I gave her the steps! I have to be there!

dialogues.text: We can’t afford it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Here. This is dessert. She sits, rips open a popsicle and takes a bite. Silence. Dwayne and Frank glance at each other, then tentatively t popsicles for themselves. Richard takes a deep breath.

dialogues.text: Okay. I’11 drive the bus.

dialogues.text: Richard. I was told explicitly I could not leave Frank by himself. No offense, Frank.

OLIVE’S BEDROOM - DAY Olive re-enters with dresses, shoes, and her swimsuit. Sh pulls a suitcase from under her bed, opens it, and begins stuffing her things in.

dialogues.text: Sheryl pleads with Dwayne.

dialogues.text: Dwayne, please. For your sister?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Come on, Dwayne! It/‘1ll be fun! Everyone stares at him. Dwayne takes his pad out and wri Frank reads over his shoulder as it comes out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: ‘This...is...unfair...All...I... ask...is...that...you...leave... me...alone.” Dwayne stops writing, folds his arms. In the background, HEAR Olive packing. Sheryl turns to Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Dwayne: Flight school. I’11 give permission. Come on. It/1l be fun. You can go to the beach. Dwayne looks at her. FOOTSTEPS start coming up the stairs Finally, he offers his hand. Sheryl shakes. Everyone is relieved. Dwayne scribbles another note. Frank reads it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: “But...I/m...not...going...to... have,..any...fun!!!" He puts his hand on Dwayne’s shoulder, FRANK (cont‘d) We're all with you on that one, Dwayne. Olive re-enters, lugging her suitcase -- she is breathles flushed with excitement.

dialogues.text: We're all coming.

RICHARD (cont’d) Now there’s no sense in entering a contest if you don’t think you’re gonna win. Now, do you think you can win Little Miss Sunshine? Sheryl starts to object, but Richard raises his hand, cut her off. Olive doesn’t seem so sure.  26. RICHARD (cont'd) Yes or no, Olive. Are you gonna win? Olive thinks it over. Then, with white-hot determination:

dialogues.text: Yes! Richard smiles and slaps the table.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We're goin’ to Florida!

dialogues.text: Richard is driving. Sheryl rides shotgun. Frank and Olive sit in the second row. Dwayne and Grandpa sit in back. Dwayne is wearing a T-shirt that says, “Jesus Was Wrong”. Olive wears a large set of headphones that completely cov her ears. She does little half-dancing moves to the music No one says anything. They’ve been driving a while. Grandpa’s arms hang limply by his side.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Jesus, I’m tired. I am so fucking tired. (to Dwayne) You know how tired I am? If some girl came up to me...begged me to fuck her...I couldn’t do it. That’s how tired I am.

dialogues.text: Dad! Your language...! Please!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: She’s listening to the music...! (loud) Hey, Olive! I’11 give youa million dollars if you turn around! Olive is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, but still, the rest of us...

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Ahhh, the rest of you... (to Dwayne) Can I give you some advice? (Dwayne shakes his head) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDPA (cont'd) I’ll do it anyway. I don’t want you making the same mistakes I did when I was young.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Great. I can’t wait to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Dwayne? This is the voice of experience talking. Are you listening? (Dwayne nods) Kid: Fuck a lot of women. Not just one woman. A lot of women. You're young...

dialogues.text: Okay, Dad? I think that’s enough.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: (ignores him) You gettin’ any right now? Tell me, really. Dwayne shakes his head. Frank, amused, can’t help but tur around to watch this conversation take place. GRANDPA (cont’d) Jesus! You're, what? Fifteen? You should be gettin’ that young stuff. There’s nothing in the world better than the young stuff!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, Dad, enough. Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Would you kindly not interrupt me, Richard? (to Dwayne) Look: right now, you’re jailbait, they’re jailbait. So it’s fine. The minute you turn eighteen -- Bam! You're lookin’ at three to five.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Dad, I’m gonna pull over...

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: So pull over! You're not gonna shut me up! Fuck you! I lived 80 years! You’re like those fuckers at Sunset Village...!

dialogues.text: What happened at Sunset Village?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, don’t encourage him.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: I‘1l tell you what happened! I pay my money, they let me in. I should be able to do what the fuck I want!

dialogues.text: He started snorting heroin.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You started snorting heroin?!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: I’m eighty!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You know, that stuff'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: What am I, an idiot? (to Dwayne) And don’t you get ideas. When you’re young, you’re crazy to do that shit.

dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Me?! I’m old! You get to be my age -- you’re crazy not to do it. Frank looks at Sheryl -- You're letting this happen? waves her hands, exasperated.

dialogues.text: We’ve tried, believe me! He's worse than a two year old. The intervention was a fiasco.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So I take it you didn’t like it at Sunset Village?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? Fucking paradise there! They cook for you. Clean for you. You got golf. A pool. Now I’m stuck with Mr. Happy here, sleeping on a sofa! Sheryl ee eK  29.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Aren’t there other places?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: He keeps getting kicked out. Sunset was number four.

dialogues.text: Motherfuckers, (to Frank) Hey, listen: I know you’re a homo, but... You go to one of these places? There’s four women for every guy. What does that say to you?

dialogues.text: You must’ve been pretty busy.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA

dialogues.text: Actually, Olive...? “A la mode” in French translates literally as “in the fashion”. A...la...mode. Mode is derived from the Latin “modus”, meaning due or proper measure. ‘There's kind of a funny story about...

dialogues.text: (cutting in) Frank...? Shut up.

dialogues.text: Richard...! Frank waves Sheryl off: don’t bother. Richard turns to Ol

dialogues.text: Richard...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, but, Olive, let me ask you: the women in Miss America...? Are they skinny, or are they fat?

dialogues.text: Okay: Coffee, coffee, grapefruit, chamomile. And here’s your ice- cream. A la mod-ee, right? I'll have your waffles in a sec! She departs. Olive stares at the ice-cream. Finally:

dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll have a bite. You mind? Dwayne? Frank? Olive’s giving away her ice-cream here. Dwayne and Frank quickly snap to.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA

Olive, you're not givin’ away all your ice-cream? What about your waffles? You can’t eat waffles without the ice-cream! You'll have lonely waffles in your stomach! C'mon, have a bite.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Wait. Don’t take it all! Stop! Olive picks up her spoon, fights them off. She takes a bi

dialogues.text: Olive...

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: You get him?

dialogues.text: I can't get a signal out.

dialogues.text: Honey, I‘1ll drive a while.

dialogues.text: Richard and Sheryl talk to a MECHANIC. Behind them, Olive and Grandpa are playing that game wher you try to slap the other person’s wrists. When Grandpa g hit, he reacts with cries of pain -- much to Olive’s deli In the background, across the lot, Dwayne and Frank sit o cinderblock wall, waiting for the situation to resolve it

dialogues.text: Well, you got a problem. Your clutch is shot.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Well, I tell you what: These old buses? We’d have to order it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How long’d that take?

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Well, it’s the weekend, so... Maybe Thursday? Richard and Sheryl react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Dwayne sit silently. Dwayne watches bitterly -- this is just one more fiasco he’s been dragged into. Frank looks on wistfully as Sheryl -- thirty yards away - glances worriedly between Richard and the Mechanic. Frank notices Dwayne’s stare. He speaks without looking at Dway

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you know this, but growing up? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (cont'd) Your Mom was the cool one. She turned me on to Proust. She could’ve done anything. Dwayne looks at Frank -~- he can’t quite believe this. He takes out his pad, half-smirking, and writes: “What happened?” Frank looks at the pad, then at Dwayne. FRANK (cont’d) She had you, Dwayne. He pats Dwayne on the leg, gets up, and walks back toward Richard and Sheryl. Dwayne is left alone, taking this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank wanders in as Richard presses the Mechanic. Grandpa and Olive stop their game and join the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, look: we’ve come two hundred miles... Is there a dealership around here?

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Well, you could call over to Clarksville, but they’re probably closed. Y’know, it’s the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes, we're all aware of that. Silence. The Mechanic feels bad for them. Dwayne re-enter

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Well, I tell you what: these old buses? You don’t need a clutch to shift from third to fourth. You just ease up on the gas. You only really need the clutch for first and second. Richard doesn’t understand what he’s getting at. MECHANIC (cont’d) What I’m sayin’ is: as long as you keep parkin’ on a hill, you get yourself goin’ fifteen, twenty miles an hour, and you just start up in third. Then you shift between third and fourth.

dialogues.text: And you can drive like that?

dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. The problem's just getting up that speed up. As long as you keep parkin’ it on a hill, you're fine. My brother and I once drove from here to Canada...

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I mean, it’s sitting here right now. There’s no hill. How do we...? The Mechanic considers this. He squints his eyes and runs his tongue back and forth across his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Well, I tell you what: You get enough people -- you just get behind there and push. Just push it up to ten, fifteen miles an hour, and you just go. Everybody jump inside, and you just go! They all stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard's at the wheel of the bus. Everyone else, includi the Mechanic, is behind the bus. The sliding door is open

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, ready?! Olive, Dad: I want you in the car first.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I know. We know.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, is everyone ready?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Ves) het.s gol Richard starts up the bus. Frank turns to the others.  38.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I just want everyone here to know I’m the pre-eminent Proust scholar in the United States,

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, go! push! They all push. The van starts rolling, slow at first, the faster and faster. Finally, they're all running behind it RICHARD (cont’d) Olive, Dad, get in! Sheryl! Olive, Grandpa, and Sheryl jump in the side door. The Mechanic fades. Frank and Dwayne keep pushing faster, RICHARD (cont'd) Okay, I’m puttin’ it into gear! Get ready! He guns the engine and shifts from neutral to third. The is REVVING low but is Powering itself nonetheless,

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay, get in! Get in! (to Richard) Slow down! you're losing them!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Iocan't! I can’t slow down! Dwayne runs up to the door. He sees Frank is fading. He runs back to Frank, gets behind him, and pushes him up alongside the bus. Frank dives in. Dwayne dives after him INT. VW BUS - oN THE ROAD - DAY Everyone cheers. Frank is Panting. Dwayne shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Is that it? Are we in?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Dwayne) “No one gets left behind! No one gets left behind!” Outstanding, soldier! Outstanding! Frank salutes him. Dwayne smiles, embarrassed. INT./EXT, vw BUS, ON THE ROAD - Day -— DRIVING MONTAGE The VW drives down an on-ramp onto the Interstate.  Boe The VW cruises down I-95. Signs pass. Scenery goes by. Inside the bus, everyone just stares out the windows. Later, Grandpa is doing magic tricks for Olive. He produc a quarter from behind her ear and gives it to her. Later, everyone is playing rock, paper, scissors. Still later, everyone is back to doing nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is pitching his business to Frank, who is bored, not as bored as he would be doing nothing. He is slouched down, barely moving. Richard, however, is in full sell mo

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: ...So I start pitching “The Winner Inside” to Stan... Two minutes in, he stops me, says, “I can sell this.”

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: This is the guy who broke Tony Robbins! He knows how to do it -- start with the book; media tour; then corporate events, consulting, videos series, direct buys on TV... There’s a science in how you roll these things out.

dialogues.speaker: . FRANK
dialogues.text: Interesting...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So now he’s at the Expo in Atlanta -- he’s been hyping it up, building the buzz -- he’s gonna send it out, do a ticking clock auction.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How about that...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: And I can detect that note of sarcasm, Frank...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What sarcasm?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But I just want you to know -- I feel sorry for you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You do? Good.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Because sarcasm is the refuge of losers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It is?! Really?!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Sarcasm is just the sour grapes of losers trying to pull winners down to their level. That’s one of the lessons of Step Four.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Wow, Richard! You’ve really opened my eyes to what a loser I am! Say, how much do I owe you for those pearls of wisdom?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It's on me, buddy. It’s on me.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay, you guys, enough. Frank, Stop at

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (pointing) “He started it!” Even Sheryl has to laugh a little at this. Pretty soon, everyone in the back is giggling. Even Dwayne smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: You are bad! You are so bad!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, go on and laugh. You’re whistling past the graveyard. Richard maintains a steely composure. Then Richard’s cell phone goes off: BEEEEP-BEEEEP. He checks the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD (cont’d) There! That's the call I've been waiting for! Everybody, please! Everyone...?! (clicks the phone) Stan! Hello...? Hello?! Hello?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is ina phone booth at a gas station / mini-mart. Everyone hangs out by the bus -- parked on a slight incli except Dwayne, who is doing push-ups on the grass nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard waits tensely. Then -- abruptly --~ he is “up”.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Stan! Richard! Yeah, yeah, no problem! So... What’d we get? He listens. Gradually, his face falls. BY THE vw -- Sheryl, Olive, Grandpa, and Frank watch Rich on the phone. Dwayne wanders back to the van.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm-gonna use the ladies room. You need to go?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: No. I’m gonna practice my routine over here,

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay. Don’t go too far. They both wander off. Frank turns to Dwayne and Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get a drink. You guys want anything? Dwayne shakes his head, but Grandpa pulls out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA,
dialogues.text: Yeah. Get me some born. Something really nasty. None of that air- brushed shit, alright? Here, here’s a twenty. Get a little treat for yourself too, if they got any fag-rags in there. Frank stares at Grandpa. Then, stoic, he takes the twenty and heads off. Dwayne and Grandpa turn back towards Richa  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands at the counter, pointing out behind-the-coun magazines to a middle-aged Indian-American PROPRIETOR.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That one. That one. And let’s try that one. No, down... Yeah, that one. And a small grape Slushee. By the front window, a good-looking YOUNG MAN is perusing newsstand, cradling a grocery bag. He stops and stares.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Frank...? Frank turns. They are startled to see each other. YOUNG MAN (cont’‘d) Oh my God! What are you doing here?! Frank puts his arms behind his back, hiding his bandages.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m...on a trip. What about...? I thought you were...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: ...With Larry? Yeah, Larry bought a beach house, right down the road about -- I don’t know -- about two miles. We’re having this big blow- out tonight and he’s all freaked we’re not gonna have enough booze. He nods to his grocery bag, filled with bottles of Merlot Larry's here...?!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: He's filling the tank. He's... Wow, I can’t believe this! How’ve you been?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: hiner. fem fine:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Good. Good. You know, I heard... Someone told me you got fired...?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. No, I quit. I quit. Enough’s enough, you know?  43.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Right. Well, good. Good for you. ‘Cause you always seemed so... tense, y’ know?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yah.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: So what’re you up to now?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m... Weighing my options. You know. Taking time off.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Well, great. That's great. The Proprietor puts three porn magazines and a grape Slus on the counter and rings them up for Frank.

dialogues.speaker: PROPRIETOR
dialogues.text: $15.94, please, sir. The Young Man glances at the magazines, then at Frank. Fr keeps his hands behind his back. An excruciating pause.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: . Well, great seeing you again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. You too.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You too. The Young Man turns and exits. Frank hands over a $20 bil He watches the Young Man walk off while the Proprietor pu the magazines in a brown wrapper and hands Frank his chan Frank takes a few steps and peers out the window. HIS POV -- The Young Man gets into a Jaguar convertible driven by a distinguished-looking BEARDED MAN. The Young Man says something and points back at the store The Bearded Man turns and cranes his neck. Frank, in the store, ducks out of view. ‘The Young Man an the Bearded Man exchange a few words, then shrug and laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they drive off. Frank watches, heartbroken. Behind him, the Proprietor picks up the Slushee and waves it.

dialogues.speaker: PROPRIETOR
dialogues.text: Ay! Don’t forget your Slushee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is grasping at straws.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, Stan, wait, lemme interrupt you... No, Stan, listen -- are you in Atlanta? ‘Cause I’m coming right by you. Maybe I can swing by and... No, Stan, listen...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa, standing by the bus, reads Richard’s body langua Richard, in the booth, talks with increasing desperation.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: He’s not getting it. Christ. He and Dwayne share a look. Grandpa turns away, troubled. Frank walks stiffly back to the bus with his Slushee and wrapper. Without looking, he hands the wrapper to Grandpa

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Not so good. Sheryl walks back to the VW as Richard hangs up the phone Richard stays in the booth for a second. Then he exits th and walks back to the VW, passing Sheryl.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Nothing. Let’s get out of here. He walks to the driver’s seat.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I thought you said this was a done deal.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He said it was a done deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn’t get anything? (beat) So where does that leave us?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It leaves us fucked. That's where it leaves us. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I’m hearing this. Did you try negotiating...?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes, I tried! I tried everything! What do you think...?! Let’s just go, okay? Let’s get out of here! He starts the car. She stares at him. He won't look at he Finally, he turns and yells: RICHARD (cont'd) Let's goll! Furious, she goes and gets in the bus, slamming the door. Everyone else gets in. Richard releases the brake and the drift down the hill. As the van rolls away, Richard shifts and GUNS the engine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Everyone avoids everyone else’s eyes. Finally, Frank glances around.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where’s Olive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive stands next to the phone booth. In the distance, the VW bus appears. It drives up and swings around the road. Dwayne slides open the door. They barely slow down. Olive dives in. The van coasts downhill. Then Richard shifts into gear and GUNS the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. vw Bus - ON THE ROAD — DAY Richard drives, Everyone is tense except Olive, who liste to her headphones. Finally, Grandpa gets up and walks up the front of the bus. He speaks quietly to Richard,

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Richard, .

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Veahee

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Listen, whatever happens ~~ at least you tried to do something on your own, which is more than most People ever do, and I include myself in that Category, rt takes guts, ang I’m proud Of you for taking the chance, okay?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, Dad. Thanks. He tries to be cool and dismissive, but Grandpa just stan there, Finally, Richard turns and makes eye contact, Awkwardly, he offers his hand to Grandpa. They Shake, RICHARD (cont'd) Thanks, Dad, INT. MCDONALDS — NIGHT Everyone sits at a table eating. No one says anything,

dialogues.speaker: EXT, MOTEL
dialogues.text: With keys in their hands, they walk along the motor court looking for their rooms.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Here's eleven. Frank, you're twelve? And Grandpa’s thirteen,

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Mom? can r sleep with Grandpa?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: That's up to him,

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Grandpa... ?  47.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Okay. I got two beds. You could still use some rehearsing...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I know! That’s why I said...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Everyone, we’re getting up at seven. 1/11 knock on your door. We want to be on the road by eight so we can be in Boca in time for registration. It’s two hundred miles, so we can’t dawdle.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Frank? You guys'1l be all right?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We'll be fine. Dwayne nods. Sheryl kisses Dwayne and Olive.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay. Goodnight. Sleep tight. Everyone waves goodnight to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl and Richard enter. Sheryl closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What a fucking nightmare...!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard... We have to talk.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Please, not now. Let’s just get through this and get home...

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: No, Richard. We need to talk now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne lies on his bed staring at the ceiling. Through th walls we can HEAR Sheryl and Richard arguing very loudly.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You said it was a done deal!!!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stan Grossman gave me his word!  48.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m not married to Stan Grossman! Jesus, Richard, what’re we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We just keep going...

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can’t, Richard, it’s too much! It’s too much, I can’t take it! Et cetera. Frank wanders out of the bathroom, squirting R his head and rubbing his scalp. He watches Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey. Don’t listen to that. Come on, let's watch the tube. He turns on the TV. Dwayne sits up and turns the TV off. lies down, stares at the ceiling again. Frank looks at hi

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m gonna brush my teeth. He turns and goes back to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frarik enters, turns on the faucet, prepares to brush his teeth. He sees himself in the mirror and stops. A beat. He opens up his wallet, pulls out the photo he looked at earlier, stares at it. Again, we can’t see the photo. He looks at himself in the mirror again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fight continues. Dwayne listens, scowling.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I trusted him, okay?! Step Three is you have to trust people!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fuck the Nine Steps, Richard! They're not working! It’s over!!! Forget it!!! I never want to hear the Nine Steps again!!! A stunned silence. Dwayne, hearing this, just barely smil  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa tucks Olive -- in pajamas -- into bed. It’s quiet can’t hear Sheryl and Richard fighting.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: There you go. Snug as a bug in a rug.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Grandpa...?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Yeah? She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I’m kind of scared about tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Olive, you're gonna blow ‘em out of the water. I guarantee it. They won't know what hit ‘em. She smiles. He’s about to leave her when...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Grandpa...? He turns back. She hesitates again. Something’s really , bothering her. GRANDPA (cont’d) It's okay. What’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to be a loser.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: You’re not a loser, Olive! Why do you say that?!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Because...! Dad hates losers. That’s what he said!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: But you’re not a loser! And your Dad would never hate you, ever!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: But what if I lose tomorrow? She’s on the verge of tears, He takes her hand.  vue

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, back up a second. You can’t lose. You know why? Because a real loser isn’t someone who doesn’t win. A real loser ig someone who’s so afraid of not winning they don’t even try. That’s not you! You're in the contest! You’re gonna dance! So even if you win, or you don’t win, you’ve already won! See? You see? You-see-you-see-you-see? He tickles her. She squeals. He stops, brushes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: I think we're gonna have fun tomorrow. You think? (she nods) Okay. I’m gonna get ready for bed. Goodnight. Sleep tight.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Don’t let the bedbugs bite! He gives her a kiss, turns off the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank re-enters from the bathroom wearing monogrammed sil pajamas, a sleeping mask on his head. Dwayne is in bed reading THUS SPOKE ZARATHUSTRA. Frank climbs into bed. Dwayne sits up, looks at Frank, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What? Dwayne shows his pad of paper to Frank. It reads: “Please don’t kill yourself tonight” Frank shakes his head. FRANK (cont’d) Not on your watch. I wouldn’t do that to you. Dwayne nods, relieved. Frank pulls his sleeping mask over his eyes, lies back. Dwayne leans over, turns out the lig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa enters and locks the door.  ile He opens his shaving kit and takes out a small mirror and tiny ziploc baggie filled with light brown powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Sheryl sit on opposite sides of the bed, not facing each other. It’s quiet. They’ve hit rock bottom.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Maybe we should try living apart. Just for a while. Richard closes his eyes. This kills him. Abruptly, Richard stands, gathers his keys, wallet, etc.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: What’re you doing? Richard...?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m gonna fix this.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m gonna fix this. Don’t worry. He grabs his coat and exits, very determined. Sheryl, lef behind, flops back on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard strides to the VW bus, parked parallel on the str A small crowd of TEENAGERS is hanging out, smoking and drinking. Three Teen Boys are puttering around on mopeds. Richard ~~ on a mission -- climbs in the VW's driver’s se and starts it up. He shifts into third and REVS the engin The VW doesn’t move. He REVS it very high and loud, jostl in his seat to try to get the bus going. It stays still. Richard takes his foot of the gas, slumps back. The Teens stop chatting and stare at him. Richard, at the of his rope, turns and looks at the Teens and their moped

dialogues.speaker: JUMP TO
dialogues.text: Richard walks up to the Teens on their mopeds. They are wary. Richard smiles, tries to be friendly.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey! How would one of you guys like to make twenty dollars? The Teens look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN BOY
dialogues.text: Fuck off, fag. This amuses the other Teens. Richard -- undeterred -- pul out his wallet, opens it up to see how much cash he has.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty highway entrance, lit by streetlamps. Interstate traffic flies by at 70mph -- cars, SUVs, eighteen wheeler Into the frame and down the entrance ramp rides Richard, balanced precariously on a borrowed moped, pushing 35mph. He edges into the break-down lane and drives parallel to SWOOSHING traffic, a look of grim determination on his fa He passes a sign that reads, “Atlanta, 23 Miles.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s quiet, An empty children’s playground sits near the motel, lit by a single streetlamp. Sheryl lies on a platform swing, rocking back and forth, smoking a cigarette, staring up at the stars. She looks at her wedding ring, jiggles it with her thumb. FADE IN the WHINE of a moped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard pulls into parking lot of a large chain hotel. A marquee out front reads, “Life/Styles Expo. Welcome!”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard comes in a side exit and strides down a long, carpeted hallway. Empty conference rooms line the hall.  53. Outside each conference room is an easel with a foam boar mock-up of a self-help book cover. Richard walks past fac after face of aspiring self-help gurus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard -- windblown, still in shorts and sneakers -- str into a well-appointed lobby. A female CONCIERGE is on lat night duty. He walks to a courtesy phone, picks ae Ue RICHARD (cont'd) (into phone) Stan Grossman, please. Thank you. Through the receiver, we hear RINGING. Then VOICE-MAIL.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE MAIL
dialogues.text: (via phone) The hotel guest you're calling is not available. Please leave a message at the tone. BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Stan, it’s Richard... (at a loss) I don’t know where the fuck you are. I’m at your hotel. Call me. He hangs up and looks around, exasperated. He takes out h cell phone and dials. He puts the phone to his ear. As the phone RINGS in his ear, we hear the synchronized BLEATING of a cell phone from the hotel bar nearby. It takes Richard a second to make the connection. He turn In the bar/lounge, a boistrous group of CORPORATE TYPES - prosperously attired men, meticulously groomed women -- a seated around a booth, drinking and laughing together. Holding court is Stan Grossman, a swarthy mid-30s go-gett wearing khakis, loafers, and a cashmere V-neck. Richard watches as Stan pulls out his cell phone, checks caller ID, shakes his head, puts the phone away. Richard -- phone in his ear -- walks over and stands behi Stan Grossman, staring down at him. The Corporate Types s laughing. Stan turns, looks up at Richard. Richard smiles RICHARD (cont’d) Hi, Stan!  34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Stan argue next to a dumpster in the parking behind the hotel. Richard’s borrowed moped is parked near

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You said it would sell...!

dialogues.speaker: STAN GROSSMAN
dialogues.text: That’s what I thought! At the time!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: But it’s a great program! You said yourself! I don’t understand...!

dialogues.speaker: STAN GROSSMAN
dialogues.text: It’s not the program, Richard, it’s you, okay? No one’s heard of you. Nobody cares. Richard exhales, shakes his head, gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So what’s the next step?

dialogues.speaker: STAN GROSSMAN
dialogues.text: There is none. We had our shot. It didn’t fly. We move on.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You mean give up.

dialogues.speaker: STAN GROSSMAN
dialogues.text: Richard...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: One set back, you’re ready to quit.

dialogues.speaker: STAN GROSSMAN
dialogues.text: Richard, listen -- I pushed this thing hard, okay? I rammed it down their fucking throats, all right? No one bought it. Now, I know the market. It’s time to move on. You’re not gonna win this one. Richard stares at Stan, absorbing this. Then he speaks wi a strained nonchalance, nodding and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay...! Good! I’m glad. You know why? This is what the Nine Steps are all about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard! Jesus...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Vou blew ie, stan. = Vouc out. Richard turns and walks off. Stan can’t believe it. He watches Richard, shakes his head and re-enters the hotel. Richard strides to the moped, looks both ways, climbs on pedals furiously. The moped sputters to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, grim, rides his borrowed moped along the breakdo lane as cars and trucks ROAR past him. This is -- hands down -- the worst moment of his life. Then there’s a FLASH of lightning and a CLAP of thunder. starts to rain. Richard keeps riding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A darkened motel room. We hear the WHINE of the moped as pulls into the parking lot and up to the door. The door opens and Richard -- dazed, soaking wet -- steps He closes the door behind him, walks over, lies on the be fully clothed -- and stares up at the ceiling. Sheryl, sleeping, wakes up and sees Richard.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Y’ okay? He nods. Sheryl rubs his arm, rolls over, goes back to sleep. Richard stares up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Dad...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard opens his eyes. Olive is standing next to the bed The blue light of dawn is coming through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What is it, hon...?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Grandpa won't wake up.  30. Richard takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are behind the lights of an ambulance as it speeds dow commercial strip. The LIGHTS FLASH and SIREN BLARES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sits silently in a waiting room, waiting for new Olive, bored, goes through a rack of medical flyers. She takes one She takes and approaches Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: You want to take an eye test? (Dwayne shakes his head) Uncle Frank? You want to take an eye test?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Olive, come here. Put that away. We're gonna have a family meeting. Dwayne? Family meeting.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What? Now?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard...! Let's just do it. a breath. She turns to the kids. SHERYL (cont‘d) First of all, the doctors are doing everything they can to help Grandpa right now. He’s had a long... (searches for words) .. eventful life, and I know he loves both of you very much. But if God wants to take him, we have to be ready to accept that, okay? (they nod) Now, I think you guys know we’ve been having money problems lately, with Richard’s venture and everything... iThings haven’t really gone the way we hoped. So it looks like when we get home we might have to make some changes in the way we live. We might have to move out of our house. We might have to declare bankruptcy. I don’t know. TI have to talk to a lawyer about all that.  She looks at Richard, the kids. Her voice becomes shaky. SHERYL (cont'd) But whatever happens -- we’re a family. What’s important is that we love each other. I love you guys so, so, so much... She turns away, starts to cry. Frank puts his hand on her shoulder. Sheryl grasps it. Olive and Dwayne watch Sheryl Dwayne writes a note, shows it to Olive. It reads: “Go hug Mom!” Olive goes and hugs Sheryl. Sheryl, crying, picks up Oliv and holds her in her lap, hugging her. Dwayne gets up, go across the waiting room and stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: A second floor view. It’s a banal suburban landscape. Car go busily back and forth on a distant road. Dwayne just stares out the window with a blank face. Behi him, a DOCTOR enters the waiting area.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Are you the family of Edwin Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is gathered in a smaller room. The Doctor closes the door behind him. He turns to face them.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. We did everything we could. He was... It was too much. He probably fell asleep and never woke up. I’11 have someone come talk about handling the remains.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Thank you. Appreciate it. The Doctor opens the door and calls down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Linda,..! He gestures, then departs. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Is Grandpa dead?  58.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Yeah, honey. He’s passed away. Olive nods, says nothing. A hospital administrator, LINDA, comes in with a sheaf of papers. She is overburdened and all business.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: I'm your bereavement liaison, Linda. My consolations for your loss.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Thank you, Linda. Linda hands Richard her sheaf of paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: (fast, indifferent) Okay. These are the forms you need to fill out -- death certificate, report of death and the M.E. pink slip. Try and be as detailed as possible. This is a brochure for our Grief Recovery Support Group that meets Tuesdays. If you’d like, I can refer you at this time to a funeral home so you can begin making arrangements. Richard and Sheryl glance at each other.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Um, actually, pre-arrangements have been made with a home in Maryland.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: In Maryland...?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, we’re passing through. Y'see, we're trying to get to Boca Raton...

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Okay -- if the body is crossing state lines? You’re gonna need a Burial Transit Permit from the County Registrar...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, but here’s the thing -- we're trying to get to Boca Raton by three o’clock this afternoon...  Dy.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Three o’clock? Today? (checks her watch) That ain’t gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It's for my daughter. This is really important.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: It may be important, but you still have to fill out this paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, I know this is unusual... Is there a way we can go and come back? I mean, can we do paperwork later?

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: You can’t abandon the body...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD LINDA
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna abandon the ...Otherwise the hospital body. I just want to go and becomes responsible... Sir, come back. We just need to there’s a way these things get to Boca and then we’1l need to be done. Sir? come back! Silence. We'll come back! Sir...? Sir!!! LINDA (cont’d) Sir, this may surprise you, but you’re not the only one who’s had someone die here today, all right?! Now we have a way of doing things around here, and I‘m gonna ask you to respect our rules and procedures! Richard stares at the floor, seething. A pause. Richard speaks with great restraint. She leads

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Could you...? Is there a way we could view the remains?

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: (nods, also restrained) I’1l show you, yes. We haven’t had a chance to move him downstairs. them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda stops in front of an intensive care room. a a ae  60.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: He’s in here. Now someone may come by in a few minutes to take him to the basement, but just tell them who you are. They’1l wait.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: When you’re done with the paperwork I'll be in the nurse’s station.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay. Great. Thank you, Linda. She departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. It’s quiet. There’s a body under a sheet. Richard walks over and peers under it, then puts it down. He turns away and faces the wall. He starts hyperventilat -- choking down the emotion. He doesn’t want to lose control, and he’s not comfortable showing his feelings.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Goddam it, Dad. Goddamn it. (beat) Stupid, stupid, stupid...!!! He shakes his head and takes a few sharp breaths, getting himself under control -- still facing the wall. Sheryl hugs Olive, stroking her hair. Olive is dry-eyed - this is all new to her. Sheryl bends down and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: We'll do Little Miss Sunshine next year. Okay, honey? Next year. Olive nods. No one says anything. Finally, Richard turns around. He is very determined.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No. We’ve come seven hundred miles. I/’11 be dammed if I’m not making that contest.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Honey... We can’t leave him!  61.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We’re not going to leave him. Richard dumps the paperwork in a wastebasket. He opens th door, glances into the hallway. He closes the door. RICHARD (cont’d) Fuck. ..! He looks desperately around the room. He sees the window. He goes to the window, opens it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard peers out the window. He’s at the back side of th building, seven or eight feet above a near-empty parking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard ducks back in. He tosses his car keys to Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Dwayne. Go around outside.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard... What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We'll take him with us.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: No, Richard. No. That’s not going to happen. *

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He’s better off with us than with these people! (to Dwayne) Go under the window. Frank, you go with him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Dwayne, don’t you dare! (to Richard) Look: you stay here. We’1ll take Olive. Frank’1l drive!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We’1l be there in two hours! I/‘1l have a funeral home meet us as soon as we arrive! {never say die:) Listen, everyone. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oz. RICHARD (cont'd) If there’s one thing Grandpa would've wanted, it’s to have Olive perform at the Little Miss Sunshine pageant. I believe we’d be doing a grave disservice to his memory if we gave up now. There’s two kinds of people in the world: winners and losers. And what’s the difference? Winners don’t give up. So what are we here? Are we winners? Or losers? CcuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard peeks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, ready? Frank, Dwayne, Sheryl and Olive stand under the window, trying to look inconspicuous. Frank gestures -- Wait. Across the lot, two NURSES stroll toward the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Not yet... Not yet... The Nurses pass out of sight. FRANK (cont’d) Okay -- go, go, go! Richard disappears for a second, then reappears with a bi bundle wrapped in a sheet. He hoists it into the window.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Careful... Careful... He edges the bundle off the window ledge. Frank and Dwayn gently lower the bundle to the ground. They glance around

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay! Here we go! One, two... Frank, Dwayne, Sheryl and Olive lift the bundle together scuttle across the parking lot to the VW bus fifty feet a An ELDERLY COUPLE walking fifty yards away observes them. FRANK (cont’d) Be cool. Be cool. Almost there. They arrive at the bus.  63. Dwayne whips open the VW’s back door (a hatchback that hi your luggage) and they hoist the bundle in. Frank slams t door closed. Richard comes sprinting into the parking lot

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay Vetus roll You ready.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Any time, Rich! Richard starts up the bus, gets out and helps them push. They get the bus rolling. The lot is at a slight incline, which helps. Finally, Richard jumps behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m putting it into gear...! Sheryl and Olive jump in the side door. Frank and Dwayne run behind the bus, pushing like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Did I mention I’m the pre-eminent Proust scholar in the US? Richard REVS the engine and puts it in third. The bus beg picking up speed. Dwayne and Frank sprint along side. This time, Dwayne is prepared to push Frank up along-side bus. Frank lunges in. Dwayne jumps in after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne slides the door shut. They’re giddy and breathless from the escape. They quickly sober up.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, what time is it?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: (checks her watch) It’s 11:30. How much further...?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I dunno. ‘Two hundred miles...?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: And when does registration end?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Three o'clock. They do the math.  64.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's gonna be close.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, we'll make it. We just can’t stop. No one has to pee, right? Olive is thinking.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Dad? What’s gonna happen to Grandpa?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Honey, aS soon as we get to Florida, I’m gonna call a funeral home in Maryland and they’1l take care of everything. Your Grandpa was smart and planned ahead. Okay? Olive nods. That’s not really what she was asking about. Sheryl sees this.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Honey, Grandpa’s soul is in Heaven now. He’s with God. Okay? Olive nods. She turns and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: . The passing landscape of the road leading back to the Interstate. It seems a long way from God.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: Begin MUSIC -- the same quiet tune that began the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VW cruises past fields, billboards, farms, rest stops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dialogue below plays over the following shots. The family drives in silence, each looking out the window Richard drives -- stoic, determined. Sheryl is pensive. She sneaks glances at Richard. Frank, subdued, watches Sheryl. He rubs Olive on the hea Olive, headphones around her neck, stares out the window. Dwayne lies across the back seat, staring up. DWAYNE’S POV -- Passing power lines undulate against the From the back, we see the highway passing as each person lost in a reverie. Sheryl, in the front, looks at Richard, reaches over and Richard's neck. Richard glances at her, keeps driving.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uncle Frank? Does everyone get to go to Heaven?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s an excellent question, Olive. Actually, the Hindus believe that you get as many lives as you want. Buddhists believe that you live many lives but at a certain point you reach Nirvana and cross the finish line. Christians believe you only get one life -- they don’t believe in do-overs.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What do you believe?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I dunno. I haven’t made my mind up. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I think everyone goes to Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Even me?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You promise?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Yes!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are cruising. Olive has her headphones back on, thou she’s not bouncing anymore -- just nodding her head. Sher points to a passing sign, “Boca Raton -- 61 Miles.”

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Sixty one miles. What time is it? Frank checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Five of two...! Sheryl looks worriedly at Richard. Richard steps on the g

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We'll make it! Don’t worry!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: We’re cutting it close...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s not even close! We'll be... A car cuts in front of him. He brakes. RICHARD (cont'd) Look out! Asshole! He HONKS the horn loudly at the guy.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He cut me off! The horn keeps HONKING intermittently.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay. You can stop now.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s not me! This thing is stuck. He tries to pull the horn button up. Instead, he gets a l continuous HOOOONK. He lets go. It stops.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
