dialogues.text: Okay, just leave it...! Silence. Then a HONK. Another silence. HONK, HONK.  67. SHERYL (cont’d) Maybe if you pull it from... She tries to lift up another part. HOOOOONK. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Just leave it, okay? We‘ll fix it when we get to Boca!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay, fine! Silence. HONK! Silence. HONK! HONK! Silence. Dwayne puts his head in his hands. He can’t stand it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How many days ‘til you enlist? Dwayne pulls out his pad and writes. He shows it: 623” Frank contemplates this. . FRANK (cont ‘d) Maybe I can adopt you. Dwayne stares out the window. HONK! Silence. HOOONK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van, its horn BLARING, cruises past a State Trooper hiding behind an evergreen. The TROOPER hits the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard sees the lights in the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus! I’m being pulled over! Everybody: act normal, okay?. Like everything is normal. Here we go... He pulls onto the breakdown lane and stops. The HORN continues HONKING intermittently. The Trooper, a 50-ish g ol’ boy, gets out and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: How’re you folks doin’ today?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Fine! Doin’ fine! (HONK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!  68.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Having trouble with your horn?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, a little trouble. (HONK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! (HONK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!!! Frank leans forward gleefully:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don’t apologize, Rich! It’s a sign of weakness! Richard ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Would you step out of your vehicle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trooper gestures towards Reluctantly, Richard gets out. the back of the van.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Would you step this way?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Don't...!

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Don’t what? Richard shuts up. The Trooper sees him glance at the trun

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: You have something in your trunk?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No! Nothing! There’s nothing. It’s just... Don’t open it. The Trooper is incredulous.  oy.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Sir, you realize you’ve just given me probable cause to search your trunk? Put your hands on top of your vehicle. Now don’t move. He shakes his head and walks back towards the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Please! It’s not illegal, it’s...

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Sir, I’d advise you to keep your mouth shut. Richard shuts up. The Trooper pulls his gun and hesitantl approaches the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone surreptitiously watches the Trooper.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: (sotto) Oh no, what’s he doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard watches the Trooper walk around the back of the b and reach for the trunk. He closes his eyes. The Trooper opens the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Whoa! Goddamn!!! Richard opens his eyes, shakes his head -- this is the en

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Six, would you come here? Richard walks back. The Trooper bends down behind the bus Rounding the corner, Richard sees the Trooper picking up Grandpa’s porn magazines, which have spilled onto the roa The bundled sheet sits in plain sight. The Trooper, distracted, gathers the magazines and stands. He grins. TROOPER (cont'd) Don’t worry, I ain’t gonna bust you. He looks in the bus, smiles and waves at Sheryl and Olive  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the bus -- minds blown -- waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trooper tidies the magazines and, grinning, shuffles through them with a connoisseur’s eye -- Swank, High Soci Black Tail. The next magazine: Honcho. A beefy, moustached stud gazes smolderingly from the cove The Trooper stops grinning. He looks at Richard. Richard shrugs and laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Trooper’s cruiser pulls back onto the highway, Richard walks to the front, climbs in, slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (steely) I’1l1 tell you when I regain consciousness. (starts the car) Frank. Dwayne. Get out and push.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are cruising. The horn HONKS in occasional spurts. Everyone ignores it. Olive plays with an eye chart she go at the hospital. She points at a diminishing set of “E”s Dwayne is in the back seat, holding a hand over one eye a pointing his finger up, down, or Sideways to correspond t the rotation of the “EB”, Dwayne makes it through the cha

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: 20/20 vision! Mom, Dwayne has 20/20 vision!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: I bet he does.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Okay, further back! Dwayne and Olive continue with the charts, with Dwayne sitting further back. Sheryl points to a passing sign.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Boca Raton! Forty six!  71. Frank checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: hes coor | Sheryl looks at Richard, who steps on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We'll make it, okay?! Maybe a few minutes late.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: No, Richard...! They said three o‘clock sharp! -They were very explicit. You don’t want to fuck with these people. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You know where it is?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: The Holiday Inn. She said it’s just off the highway. You can’t miss it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: She better be right. In the back, Olive pulls out a new flyer.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Okay, now I’m gonna test if you’re colorblind. What letter is in the circle? She holds up a chart with a green circle. Inside the circ in a mosaic pattern, is a bright red letter “A”. Dwayne makes a gesture, “There's nothing there.” OLIVE (cont’d) No, inside the circle! Right there! Dwayne shakes his head again. Olive glances at Frank. OLIVE (cont’d) It’s an “A”! Can’t you see it?! It’s red! See? Right there! Dwayne takes the chart and stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You can’t see the “A”? It’s bright red. Can you see the difference between the green and the red? Dwayne shakes his head helplessly. Frank turns away.  72. FRANK (cont‘d) Oh, man. Dwayne looks at him. He pulls out his pad and writes: “What?” Frank doesn’t say anything. Dwayne points violently at th pad. Frank looks at him. Quietly: FRANK (cont'd) Dwayne. I think you’re colorblind. Dwayne doesn’t understand. He points at the pad again. FRANK (cont’d) You can’t fly jets in the Navy if you're colorblind. Dwayne does nothing. Then he seems to implode in on himse curling up in a ball. Frank shouts towards the front. FRANK (cont’d) Rich, pull over!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We have an emergency back here!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just pull over!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What’s the emergency?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sheryl, will you make him pull over?!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We’re gonna be late if...

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard!!!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I'm pulling over, okay?! I’m pulling over!  73. He puts on the clicker.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, SIDE OF THE INTERSTATE
dialogues.text: The bus pulls into the break-down lane beside the highway The door slides open and Dwayne gets out onto the grassy slope by the side of the road. He walks off with his head his hands. This is the first time we’ve heard his voice.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Fuck!!! (beat) Fuck!!! The others get out of the car and watch him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He's colorblind. He can’t fly.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. Oh, no. Thirty yards away Dwayne falls to his knees, buries his h and face in the grass, and SHRIEKS like a wild animal. There’s an out-of-control quality to his behavior that is scary and disturbing. Finally, Dwayne rolls to a sitting position, his hands covering his face. He sits there crying. The others don’t know what to do. Richard glances at Sheryl. He points at his watch and shr SHERYL (cont’d) Let’s give him a second. In the background, the VW keeps HONKING like some demonic beast -- mocking Dwayne’s helplessness. Finally, Sheryl approaches Dwayne. SHERYL (cont’d) Dwayne? Honey? I’m sorry. He says nothing. She sighs.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Dwayne... Come on, we gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: I’m not going.  74.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Dwayne...

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: I’m not! I don’t care! I’m not getting in that bus again!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Dwayne... For better or worse: we're your family... Dwayne stands up and screams at them.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: You’re not my family! I don’t want to be your family! I hate you fucking people! I hate you! (he points at them) Divorce! Bankrupt! Suicide! You're losers! You’re fucking losers! Everyone is stunned by this outburst. Dwayne puts his han over his eyes and sits down again. DWAYNE (cont'd) Just leave me, Mom. Please? Just leave me here. Sheryl gets up and walks back to the others.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We're gonna be late. Can we leave somebody here with him?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I‘ll stay.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: No, we’re not doing that.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Olive, you want to talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: No, Richard. There’s nothing to say. We just have to wait. A beat. Then Olive walks over and sits down next to Dwayn Dwayne’s face is red and snot is dribbling from his nose. has a piece of straw and he’s poking some ants in the gra  Uc She puts her arm on his shoulder and watches him poke. Th ants climb busily over the grass. They sit quietly. Then Dwayne stands up.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s go. He walks back to the others. His voice is automatic. DWAYNE (contd) I apologize for the things I said. I was upset. I didn’t really mean them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (mock~tender) Dwayne... We know you did.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Frank... (to Dwayne) It’s okay. Let’s just go. They all start pushing the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is weaving through traffic -- the engine’s REVVIN VERY HIGH. Richard, Sheryl, Olive, and Frank are looking ahead intently. Dwayne is slouched in the back, staring a “nothing. The horn has tapered off to an occasional HONK. Frank checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: oe!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We're gonna make it! Olive, don’t worry! We'll be on time!

dialogues.speaker: JUMP TO
dialogues.text: The same. Frank checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Just look for the exit! It’s coming up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same. Frank checks his watch again.
No one says anything. Then Richard points.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: There! That’s it! Can anyone see a Holiday Inn? A beat. Olive points.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: There! Little Miss Sunshine! As they ride up the exit ramp, the sign in front of the Holiday Inn reads, “Little Miss Sunshine.” Richard comes off the ramp onto a four lane commercial ro There’s a maze of service roads and parking lots between and the Holiday Inn. Richard is baffled.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How the fuck do you get over there?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Turn here! Turn here! Richard takes a right into a service road. SHERYL (cont’d) Will you slow down?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Pecanyt l= fem an third gear!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Does anyone see a turn-off? How the fuck do you get over there? They drive past the Holiday Inn -- a few hundred yards aw

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Dad! You drove past it!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: There’s no place to turn in!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Turn around! You gotta turn around!  Wc

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, hold on, everybody. The VW screeches around in a wide arc across four lanes o (luckily empty) traffic. Richard guns the under-revving engine. They again drive past the distant Holiday Inn. RICHARD (cont’d) Can anyone see a way in?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Go over there, then cut across!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, hold on! The VW squeals around a left turn onto another service ro RICHARD (cont’d) There’s no way in! What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Dad! You're driving past it!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: There! Into the parking lot! She points. Richard turns into an enormous empty parking lot. He drives towards the Holiday Inn in the distance. There's still no clear path on how to get there.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s a dead end!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: No, go over there!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s the same! There’s no way...! He turns the wheel and they begin tracing a wide loop -- bombing around the parking lot at 35mph in a holding patt

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Three o’clock!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Dad...!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Go back out!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We tried that! There’s no way in!  78.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: So we just keep going in circles? Richard says nothing. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay: Hold on, everybody! Olive, put your seat belt on. He comes out of a wide arc and heads straight for the med strips separating him from the Holiday Im.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hold on, everyone! He guns it. As soon as he hits the first median, the HORN goes off and doesn’t stop. They’re in a new parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Look out! Richard goes SCREECHING past several parked cars. They’re one median strip away from the Holiday Inn parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: One more! Here we go! Hold on! They hit the median hard. A big ‘pump. They've made it in the Holiday Inn parking lot. The whole van sags to the re Frank looks out the rear window. A tire is wheeling off across the parking lot by itself.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We lost a tire, Rich!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We'll get it later! Here we go! They come gliding into a parking space, HORN BLARING. Frank yanks open the sliding door. It slides back, slams into the end of the track and derails. The whole door fal off the side of the van and into the parking lot. Frank doesn’t even look back. He sprints across the lot towards a distant banner marked “Little Miss Sunshine.” All the others -~ except Dwayne -- sprint after him.  Ue)s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big carpeted hotel lobby. The doors open and Frank comes in, breathless. He stops. The place is crawling with tiny blond girls and their stressed mothers. The girls are dressed, coiffed and made to within an inch of their life. Nearby, a CONTEST OFFICIAL is packing up her things behin table with a “Registration” banner. Frank sprints up to her. The others catch up and stand, looking on -- desperate, disshevelled, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hi, we’re here to register!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, we're closed.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: But we have an entrant. Right here. We just need to check in.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Registration ended at three.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's three now!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: No... She points to a clock on the wall. It’s 3:04PM.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Oh, have a heart! We’re four minutes late! We just drove all the way from Maryland...!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Then you should have been here by three. She tries to leave. Richard stops her.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait! How can we make this work?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Everyone else was here before three. I’d be giving unfair advantage...  80.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We’re not asking for an advantage! We just want to compete!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Don’t yell at me, sir. I didn’t make you late. We've settled on the schedule of the show and we‘ve turned off our computers. Now the show starts in twenty minutes, I have a hair check to do, I'm sorry you’re late, but I can’t help you. She tries to leave but they block her way. Richard gets o his knees.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Please! You don’t know what we've been through...!

dialogues.speaker: SOUND GUY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uh, Ms. Jenkins...? They all turn. There’s a SOUND GUY -- a very portly young man with a high voice -- who’s clearly just heard the sto SOUND GUY (cont’d) I can put ‘em in the system.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Oh, Kirby, you don’t have to!

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: No, it’s okay. It’s five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Well... It’s your time. ‘Scuse me. She pushes past them. Frank leaps up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hello! Everyone?! We've just witnessed a great act of compassion and human kindness! Exhibit A: we’‘ve got Eva Braun here -- making the trains run on time, and B: Kirby! My man! Currently the greatest human being on the planet! Applause, please! He leads the others in applause. Everyone else in the lob ignores them, Kirby smiles, flips on the computer, They crowd around.  81.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Thank you so much! You don’t know what this means...

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Please. It’s five minutes. He glances in the direction of the Official, who has departed, and shakes his head, Quietly: KIRBY (cont'd) I ain’t working for these People again. These people are crazy. (to Olive) So, what’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Olive.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Olive. That’s a nice name, She smiles. He Starts tapping away at the computer. Olive glances away and freezes, Across the room is Miss Florida, sitting behind a table, signing photos for kids. Olive is in awe, OLIVE (cont'd) Mom! It’s Miss Florida! Look! It’s really her!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: You want to say hello? Olive shakes her head, intimidated -- it’s like meeting a SHERYL (cont’d) Come on, she looks nice. We'll just say hi. (to Richard) You got this? rr T’ll take care of it. Sheryl drags Olive to the back of the line -- a half a do girls and their mothers. The GIRL pos eecee ore turns and stares at Olive -- sizing up the competition. Olive smile  82. Olive takes this in stride. Frank and Dwayne approach, carrying the family’s luggage and a Sunday NY Times.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey. I’m getting a room. We’1l set up a base camp.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll come find you. Frank and Dwayne walk off. Olive watches them go, then tu and looks at the other girls. Again, they’re all miniature Barbies with expensive cloth and hair. All of them are several inches shorter than Oli who is still dressed in her traveling clothes -- denim cu offs and black Converse high-tops. She stands out. Two TWIN GIRLS are chasing each other around, giggling. Olive watches. Eventually, the Twins see Olive watching t They whisper to each other and giggle. Olive gives them a friendly half-smile. Finally, the Twin Girls approach Oli

dialogues.speaker: TWIN GIRL ONE
dialogues.text: Are you on a diet?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TWIN GIRL ONE
dialogues.text: Are you on a diet?

dialogues.speaker: TWIN GIRL TWO
dialogues.text: Didn’t think so! They dissolve into giggles and run away. Olive is disturb Sheryl is steamed but doesn’t know what to do,

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Kirby finishes up with Richard -- having him sign a relea

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: And sign... (Richard signs) ...And you’re done! Here’s your receipt; tickets; sash; tiara. Anything else?  83.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah. Is there a funeral home around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet, empty room. Frank and Dwayne enter, dropping the luggage on the floor Dwayne immediately walks to a bed in the corner of the ro and lies facing the wall. Frank surveys the room with a jaundiced eye. He walks over, peers out the window. Frank turns, looks at Dwayne lying on the bed. He walks over, settles into a chair, pulls out his NY Times.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey, you know, facing the wall like that...? There’s no way you gonna stop me from killing myself. No way! I could be out the window before you even turn around. A beat. He opens up a Sunday New York Times. FRANK (cont’d) Sorry. He looks at Dwayne for a few beats, then shakes his head Opens up the Book Review section.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BOOK REVIEW
dialogues.text: is a full-page ad for Understanding Proust by Larry Sugar A banner reads, “The Surprise Bestseller from America’s # Proust Scholar!” There’s a photo of Larry Sugarman, in a beard and glasses, looking very serious. Frank stares at the ad.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, HOLIDAY INN BALCONY
dialogues.text: Frank opens a sliding door and steps on to the tiny balco He walks to the edge and looks over. It’s eight floors down to the parking lot. Frank considers the drop. Then he pulls out his wallet and takes out the photograph  84. THE PHOTO shows Frank and the Young Man from the convenie store at some chic party, wearing tuxes, smiling, and drinking Champagne. Frank stares at the photo. He looks up and surveys his surroundings -~ a rather grim landscape of Burger Kings and Jiffy Lubes. Quietly, he puts the photo away and turns back to the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard approaches the VW bus with two funeral home WORKE in jumpsuits who affect a bored, seen-it-all demeanor. WORKER ONE, 40s, is an old pro. WORKER TWO, 20s, is a fre faced rookie. A FUNERAL HOME VAN is parked in the backgro

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: ...We’re driving five, six hours -- we thought he was napping. By the time we figured it out it was too late.

dialogues.speaker: WORKER ONE
dialogues.text: ...Too late. So where’s the body? Richard turns, pops the trunk, averts his eyes, and opens The Workers look in the trunk. Then look at Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive finally makes it to the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FLORIDA
dialogues.text: Hi! What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Olive.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FLORIDA
dialogues.text: What's your talent, Olive?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I like dancing!

dialogues.speaker: MISS FLORIDA
dialogues.text: Dancing? Dancing was too hard for me! I’m a singer. You must be a good dancer!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Iam! I’m really good!  85.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FLORIDA
dialogues.text: I bet you are! Well, thanks for stopping by, Olive. Best of luck! But Olive is not quite ready to move on. OLIVE (cont’d) Ummm... Miss Florida?

dialogues.speaker: MISS FLORIDA
dialogues.text: You can call me Bonnie!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Bonnie...? Do you eat ice cream?

dialogues.speaker: MISS FLORIDA
dialogues.text: (perplexed) yes! I love ice cream! My favorite flavor is Chocolate Cherry Garcia. Although, technically, I think that’s a frozen yogurt. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you, Bonnie! Bye!

dialogues.speaker: MISS FLORIDA
dialogues.text: Bye! (to the next girl) Hi, what’s your name? Sheryl and Olive head off.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: She eats ice cream, Mom! “SHERYL I heard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard signs an invoice. Worker Two closes the rear door van, climbs in the driver’s seat and starts the engine. Richard hands the clipboard to Worker One. He hands Richa cardboard box containing a wallet, glasses, a keychain, e WORKER ONE (cont’d) The personal effects...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Oh. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: WORKER ONE
dialogues.text: You take care.  86.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You too. Thanks. Worker One gets in the van and slams the door. The van pulls out, drives to the edge of the parking lot puts on its turn signal. Richard watches. The van pulls into the street and drives off, disappearing into traffic Richard is left alone, holding the box of Grandpa’s stuff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl and Olive enter. Dwayne is still on the bed facing the wall. Frank is slumped in a chair, staring at nothing

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Frank...? How're you guys doing? Sheryl silently points at Dwayne. Frank shrugs. Sheryl go and starts opening luggage. She pulls out a bathing suit.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay, Olive. Let’s put on your swimsuit. Here. You want to change in the bathroom? Olive takes the swim-suit and goes into the bathroom. Sheryl begins gathering up Olive’s costumes. SHERYL (cont/’d) Dwayne, I know you hate all of us and want to kill yourself. But since we’re here anyway, why don’t you guys go to the beach?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey, there’s an idea! The beach! Come on, we’ll walk over, go surfing, maybe meet some chicks... Whaddaya say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive finishes putting on her swim-suit. There’s a full- length mirror on the back of the bathroom door. Olive turns around and reaches for the door knob. She sto She steps back and looks at herself in the mirror. She turns sideways. She sucks her stomach in. This is the first time she’s ever done this.  87.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Frank, here’s your tickets. That’s you and Dwayne. She’s going on last, now, because we were late...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We’ll be there. Don’t worry. Qlive turns back frontal. She lets her stomach hang out. She’s not happy with what she sees -- also the first time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl finishes gathering up Olive’s costumes.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Olive, you ready? We gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive stares at herself in the mirror. She’s making up he mind about something. (Winner or Loser?) Then, very determined, she walks out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive comes out. Sheryl is there.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: You ready? Let’s go! (to Frank) Frank, do your best! They exit. A beat. Dwayne sits up. He’s depressed, but no longer catatonic. He looks at Fran

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard -- holding the box of Grandpa’s stuff -- finds a bench and sits down. He seems shaken. Around him, the pre-pageant hubbub is at a fever pitch. He flips through Grandpa’s stuff -- keys, glasses, gum.  88. He looks up and surveys the frenetic activity -- mothers combing their daughters’ hair, little girls practicing ba moves, girls crying, girls laughing and chasing each othe Then, across the lobby, the elevator doors open and Shery and Olive step off carrying garment bags and travel cases Richard gets up and intercepts them. Sheryl sees him comi

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Hey. D’you take care of...?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did. Wait a sec. Olive, come here. Time for a pep talk.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard, we're late already...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: This is important! Olive, come here. She goes to him. He hunches down, takes her hand, searchi for words as if the very meaning of his life were at stak RICHARD (cont’d) Olive... I know you and Grandpa worked on this together. I know how much it meant to him. We drove nine hundred miles to get here. Our car broke down. We've been through a lot. But I think it’d all be worth it...if you won tonight.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard! Jesus! Olive, come on! She tries to pull Olive away but Richard holds on to her.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, Olive? Okay? Olive stares. She really wants to please him. She nods. RICHARD (cont‘d) Good girl! Go knock ‘em dead! Sheryl shakes her head and pulls Olive off towards the backstage area. Richard watches them go. INT. BACKSTAGE -— DAY Sheryl and Olive wander past one little girl after anothe each being primped to perfection by her Mom or a Groomer.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl finds a tiny empty dressing room in back and hangs garment bag of Olive’s costumes on the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Okay, we have about one minute. You want to do hair or make-up? Olive thinks. It’s like the fate of the free world is at stake. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Make-up...! Kirby pokes his head in the door.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Hey. I need your music! Olive goes to her bag, digs in, hands him a disc.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: This? Did you choose this?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: My Grandpa did.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Your Grandpa? What track?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Twelve. Oh, one thing...? She glances at Sheryl, then goes and whispers in Kirby’s Kirby smiles,

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Okay, you got it.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Kirby!

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I'll be looking for you. He departs.  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard finds his reserved seats -- four seats on the ais He sits in the fourth seat and lays his jacket across the other three, saving them for Sheryl, Dwayne, and Frank. The guy next to him is a grizzled BIKER sitting impassive with his arms folded. Richard tries to be friendly.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey. The Biker glances at him and nods. Richard persists. RICHARD (cont'd) You got a kid in the show? The Biker looks at him. He takes an earplug out of his ea

dialogues.speaker: BIKER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You got a kid in the show? The Biker stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: BIKER
dialogues.text: First time? Richard nods -- Yeah! The Biker nods ~- Figures. He puts the earplug back in his ear and resumes his impassive sta Richard is unnerved. The LIGHTS DIM. Onstage, an MC steps up to a microphone. A DRUMROLL.

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Welcome to the 14th annual Little Miss Sunshine pageant! Let’s welcome the contestants! MUSIC. Big APPLAUSE. Twenty-five little girls parade out on stage in swim-suit Twenty of them are blond -- some bleached. They’ve been arranged from shortest to tallest. Olive -- at least two inches taller than everyone else -- at the end of the line. The girls parade around in a loop, waving and smiling. They end up in a line running across the stage.  g1. MC (cont’d) We have twenty five contestants from all over the State of Florida. At the end of the evening, one of these girls will be crowned Little Miss Sunshine! Richard, in the audience, claps enthusiastically. The Bik claps without enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glorious, sunny day. The ocean stretches out to infinit Dwayne and Frank, in swim trunks, are ata surfboard renta shop on the beach. The ocean’s dead calm. Frank is handin money to a DUDE at the shop. Dwayne looks out at the wate

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: There’s no waves, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We don’t need waves. We'll just paddie out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MC is up on the stage. Another DRUMROLL.

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: ...Let’s hear a big round of applause for the evening wear! MUSIC. Big APPLAUSE. The same girls -- in precocious evening-wear -- come out in the same order and do the sam little loop around the stage. Olive’s on the end again. Richard, in the crowd, applauds -- a little less heartily

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Dwayne paddle straight out into the ocean. It’s calm, but the shore is a long way away. Dwayne looks back

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: How far are we?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I dunno. Quarter mile?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: You wanna stop? Frank shrugs. They stop. Frank looks down into the water.  92.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey. Think you can touch bottom?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: How far is it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Must be ten, twelve feet. Come on! Y’ready? On your mark, get set... They dive down into the water.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: It’s about fifteen feet to the white sand on the bottom. Dwayne swims all the way down to the bottom. Frank swims down more slowly. He finally makes it. He comically mimes that he’s drowning. Then he and Dwayne come back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They resurface.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Victory! Yes! They rest on their surfboards, breathing hard. Then, without waiting, Dwayne dives down in the water aga

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Shots of Frank and Dwayne swimming in the blue water with white sand and shafts of sunlight. It’s beautiful. They do flips, twists, spins. Dwayne swims down to the bottom again. He stays, looking at the surface, Frank’s legs, his empty board, the sunlig Then he swims back up to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MC is up on stage. Another DRUMROLL.  93.

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: And now! The moment you’ve been waiting for! The talent competition! Ladies and gentleman, please welcome Amber Tiffany Harper, who'll be singing a tune from the Broadway show, “Annie.” Amber...! A little girl walks out -- very stagy -- and begins to si

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: “The sun’1l1 come out...tomorrow...” Richard sits in the audience. He’s growing uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit on their boards and look out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Man, it’s beautiful out here. (beat) I don’t know if I believe in God, but the ocean -- it’s always here for you: infinitely bigger than you are, and completely indifferent. So... My version of God.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Frank. ..? (Frank looks over) What‘d it feel like when you cut your wrists? Frank takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You know, I wish I could tell you I felt bad. But I didn’t. I was... Outside the world, y’know? It was very peaceful. (beat) But, I’m feeling that way now, too, so... He shrugs. Dwayne nods. He looks out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wish I could just go to sleep until I was eighteen. Just skip all this crap -- high school and everything. Just skip it... He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Y’ever hear of Marcel Proust?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: He’s the guy you teach?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. French writer. Total loser. Never had a real job. Unrequited love affairs. Gay. Spent twenty years writing a book almost no one reads. But...he was also probably the greatest writer since Shakespeare. Anyway, he gets down to the end of his life, he looks back and he decides that all the years he suffered -- those were the best years of his life. Because they made him who he was. They forced him to think and grow, and to feel very deeply. And the years he was happy? Total waste. Didn't learn anything. Dwayne grins. FRANK (cont’d) So, if you sleep til you're eighteen... (scoffs) ...Think of the suffering you’d miss! High school’s your prime suffering years. You don’t get better suffering than that! Unless you go into academia, but that’s a different story. They share a smile. Dwayne gazes out to sea. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: You know what...? (Frank looks over) Fuck beauty contests. It’s like life is one fucking beauty contest after another these days. School, then college, then work. Fuck it. Fuck the Naval Academy. Fuck the MacArthur Foundation. If I want to fly, I‘1ll find a way to fly. You do what you love and fuck the rest. Frank stares at Dwayne, impressed. Dwayne glances at Fran who tries to play it cool.  95.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m glad you‘re talking again, Dwayne. You’re not nearly as stupid as you look. Dwayne smiles. Frank looks around. FRANK (cont’d) So now what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: You got me, Frank. Maybe we can stay out here forever. A beat. They look at each other. DWAYNE (cont’d) We should go. They begin paddling back to shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny girl in a COWGIRL outfit -- smiling like crazy -- her way through a tap-dance routine. She’s fantastic. Richard’s smile is fading. He’s really starting to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank exits a T-shirt shop and throws a shirt Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I can’t believe we found these. I hope they fit. As they stride up the boardwalk, he strips off his shirt puts on his new T-shirt. In big block letters, it says: “LOSER” Dwayne puts on his. It’s the same. Frank looks at him. FRANK (cont‘d) You're every mother’s dream, Dwayne. Come on. They head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another TINY BLONDE GIRL sings while flouncing and pranci across the stage, blowing kisses and twirling a parasol. She skips around the MC, flirting and batting her eyes.  96. The audience -- charmed -- starts clapping along. As she finishes, the audience rises as one in a standing ovation Richard is the only one to remain seated. His face sinks reality finally hits him -- there’s no way Olive will win He gets up and departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Dwayne enter and stride towards the doors of th auditorium. A pant-suited GRANDMA is sneaking a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is it over?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: Not yet. They open the door and walk into a BLAST of syrupy singin The door shuts. The door reopens. Frank and Dwayne stagge out. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: I’m going backstage.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Right. See ya. Dwayne heads off as Frank leans against a wall, recoverin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne strides through the backstage, looking for Sheryl Olive. With his wet Mohawk and LOSER t-shirt, he stands o A PAGEANT OFFICER tries to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: PAGEANT OFFICER
dialogues.text: Excuse me? You authorized to be backstage?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: No. He continues walking. Everywhere there are little blond g crying, whining, or lolling about. All the mothers are ov dressed, over-coiffed, and over-stressed. It’s depressing He stops, turns to a little PRINCESS slouched on a sofa. DWAYNE (cont’d) Hey. Where are the dressing rooms?  97.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: Are you allowed to be here?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Just tell me where the dressing rooms are.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: (yelling off-screen) Security! Security!!! Help!!! Dwayne rolls his eyes, moves on,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard wanders through the backstage. He spots Sheryl an Olive in a small dressing room in the back. He approaches Olive is sitting in a make-up chair, wearing gold hot pan and a red top. It’s a slightly bizarre ensemble, given he girlish plumpness. Richard hesitates. Sheryl sees him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Hey. What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I came to wish Olive good luck. {to Olive) How're you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: (weak) Good.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Nervous.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You're gonna do great! I know it! (to Sheryl) Can I talk to you a sec? She nods. They wander a few steps out of Olive’s hearing range. Richard is agitated, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I don’t want Olive to go on.  98.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: (can’t believe it) Are you kidding...?!!!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We're not in Maryland anymore, all right? She’s out of her league here.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Sheryl...! She's not gonna win. There’s no fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter...!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It dees matter!

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It does!!! Suddenly, all Richard's emotions rush to the surface. RICHARD . I don’t want her to lose. I know what that feels like. It’s not good. We can’t let that happen. She stares at him. It’s the first time he’s admitted to a kind of vulnerability or weakness. She takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Richard... They look at each other. This is the first honest moment we've seen between them. Unfortunately, they are interrupted by Dwayne, who enters a determined look on his face. Sheryl sees him coming.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Hey. How're you feeling?!

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Better. Where’s Olive?

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: In the dressing room. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: rr sotto) Io don’t want Olive doing this.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Oh, my Godeeet

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: See?!

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Mom, look around! This Place is fucked! Tf don’t want these People judging Olive! Fuck them!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Exactly! Fuck them! Dwayne glances at Richard, unnerved by his agreement.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: No, Dwayne, It’s too late...

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: It’s not too late! You're the Mom! You're Supposed to protect her! Sheryl stares at him. a clipboard-wielding, head-set wear ASSISTANT passes by and calls out.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Olive Harvey! Two minutes. He walks on, They watch him go. Dwayne and Sheryl face of

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: She’s not a beauty queen, Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive stands near the doorway, listening, Her face betray nothing. Dwayne’s VOICE is faint but clear.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: +. She’s just not. INT. BACKSTAGE -— NIGHT Sheryl and Dwayne stare at each other,

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Listen to me. (teary-eyed) Olive is who she is. This is what she’s chosen to do...  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive turns, walks mechanically back to her chair and sit

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...She’s worked hard, she’s poured herself into it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl puts a hand on Dwayne’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: ...We can’t take it away from her. We just can’t. Dwayne closes his eyes, hangs his head. Sheryl hugs him. SHERYL (cont'd) I know you want to protect her, but... We gotta let Olive be Olive. For better or worse... The clipboard-wielding ASSISTANT returns.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Olive Harvey? Are you the Harveys? They nod and return -- en masse -- to the dressing room. Olive is seated in her chair, staring dumbly at: the floo

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Olive? Time to go. Olive doesn’t move. Sheryl goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Olive...? Honey, are you okay? Olive won't look at her. Sheryl glances at Richard.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Um... We need to go.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Hang on. (to Olive) Honey...? Olive, look at me. (Olive looks) You don’t have to do this if you don’t want. If you want to sit this one out, that’s fine. We're proud of you anyway, okay? A beat. The Assistant checks his watch.  101.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: It's time. Silence. Olive stands up. She walks to the Assistant. ASSISTANT (cont’d) Okay. Let’s go. He takes her hand. They stride off. Dwayne, Sheryl, and Richard stand together and watch -- m powerless -- as Olive is lead off. TRACKING BACKWARDS with Olive. She’s got her game face on a mask of fear and determination. Sheryl calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Good luck, honey! Olive keeps walking, not looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank re-enters. Dwayne and Sheryl are coming the other w

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is she going on?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: She's going on. They enter the auditorium together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet another LITTLE BLOND GIRL is onstage, taking her bows polite APPLAUSE. Richard leads Sheryl, Dwayne, and Frank their seats. The MC comes on stage.

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: Very nice. Thank you. Okay, you’ve been a patient audience tonight...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WINGS
dialogues.text: Olive stands next to the edge of the curtain watching the MC (cont’d) ...We have one more contestant and then we'll be crowning the winner. So please welcome, from the Fort Myers district, Olive Harvey!  102. APPLAUSE. WE FOLLOW Olive out onto the stage. The LIGHTS are blinding. The AUDIENCE is hidden in darkness. There’s a crowd MURMUR because of her hot-pants get-up. Dwayne, Frank, Sheryl, and Richard applaud nervously. Richard takes Sheryl’s hand, squeezes it. They share a lo Olive waves over the MC. He walks over to her and holds t mic down for her to speak. She takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: I'd like to dedicate this to my Grandpa, who helped me do this routine.

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: That’s sweet! Is he here? Where’s your Grandpa right now?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: He’s in the trunk of our car. The MC doesn’t know how to react. Mc Okay! Well! Take it away, Olive! He retreats. She is alone on stage. Some 12 YEAR OLD BOYS in the audience decide to be cruel. One of them “moos”.

dialogues.speaker: BOY ONE
dialogues.text: Moooo! GIGGLES and SHUSHES. Another boy chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: BOY TWO
dialogues.text: Arf! Arf! Arf! More GIGGLES and SHUSHES. Miss Florida, at the judges tab by the stage, looks around sternly. She feels bad for Oli Olive is confused. She doesn’t understand these noises. Dwayne hangs his head. Frank looks around.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where are those fuckers?! I'll kill ‘em!  103. Then Olive finds what she’s looking for: Kirby, in the sound booth. He nods at her. She nods at him. Then Olive turns around, her back to the audience. Kirby turns a VOLUME knob up to “6”. He hits “play”. {The music clearly depends on the rights. For specificity we’ll use “Peach” by Prince.] A BLAST of hard rock 12 bar blues comes out of the speake Everyone is surprised. The music is hard-driving and nasty. It is completely different from the other pageant music we’ve heard so far For the first four measures, with Prince saying, “Here sh comes,” and “She got them gold hot-pants on again,” Olive barely moves, rocking her shoulders and hips to the beat. Dwayne, Frank, Sheryl, and Richard all glance at each oth This is not what they expected. No one knows what to make of Olive rocking, her back turn However, when the first verse begins, Olive turns and str up the stage -- hands on hips, shoulders swinging -- with absolute and spectacular physical self-confidence. She rocks out, busting crazy moves this stage has never s shakes, shimmies, twirls, dips, undulations ~- a melange rump-shakin’, Solid Gold Dancers re-runs, and out-of-left inventions of her own. Other moves are clearly drawn from Grandpa’s sixty-year career of strip-bar patronage. She dances with a total command -- an exuberant, even wit mastery of her body, the music, the moves, everything. Most of all, she’s doing it for herself -- for her own se of fun -- and the judges are instantly irrelevant. The audience is stunned. No one moves, Mouths hang open. Sheryl, Frank, and Dwayne gape. Richard is baffled.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What’s she doing? What the hell is she doing?!  104. When the first verse ends, Olive punctuates the 12-bar va with a series of violent pelvic thrusts. Everyone is totally shocked. No one knows how to react.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...! Abruptly, Frank starts laughing in disbelief. He stands and begins cheering Olive, pumping his fist and grooving to the music. Richard stares at Frank. Cautiously encouraged, he stands and cheers along with Frank -- tentative at first, then m and more unselfconsciously. Sheryl and Dwayne join in, relieved and amazed. Grandpa was right -- she’s blowing them out of the water. As the second verse ends and the guitar solo begins, Oliv punctuates the vamp with another series of thrusts. This is too much for the contest Official from the registration desk, who sits near the stage at the table o contest JUDGES, including Miss Florida. She looks around spots Sheryl, Richard, Frank, et al, standing and cheerin The Official gets up, walks up the aisle and yells at She

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: What is your daughter doing?! Sheryl ~-- taken aback -- shrugs. Richard leans in.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: She's kicking ass, is what she’s doing! The others smile and nod. The Official is incensed. She turns and walks back to the sound booth. She yells at Kir

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Turn the music off!!!

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (fake deaf) What...?!  105. He smiles and cranks the music up to “8”. Mothers and children in the audience clap their hands over their ears The audience polarizes -- some (the Grizzled Biker; Miss Florida) stand and cheer while others sit dumbfound or fr disapprovingly, shaking their heads. Still others flee fo the exit, heads down, hands over their ears. The Official, furious, leaves Kirby and stalks down the a to the stage. Sheryl watches with growing worry. SHERYL (cont'd) What's she doing? Look...! She shakes Richard, points. The Official goes to the MC -- at the side of the stage - waves to him. He bends down, listens. He nods. The MC walks onstage and tries to stop Olive from dancing grabbing her arms. Olive doesn’t know what he’s doing, but she won’t let him break her routine. She wiggles away and keeps dancing. Richard -- outraged -- races to the front of the auditori leaps on the stage, jumps on the MC’s back and rides him piggy-back -- into the wings. They crash to the ground. Olive stops dancing, turns and looks at Richard. Richard, grappling with the MC, waves her on.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Keep dancing, Honey! Just dance! Olive turns and stares at the audience. Dwayne, Frank and Sheryl are gesturing -- “Keep going!” Olive -- hearing the music, seeing Sheryl, Frank, and Dwa cheering her -- starts to dance again, fluid and relaxed. Richard disentangles himself from the pissed-off MC as STAGEHANDS step in and pull them apart. Richard shrugs of their restraining hands, then turns to watch Olive dance. The Contest Official steps forward and angrily confronts

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Get your daughter off stage now! Richard -- taken aback -- hesitates. She presses him.  106. OFFICIAL (cont'd) If you don’t stop her, she’ll be disqualified! Richard stares at her. Then he nods.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay. He turns and walks out on stage. Olive, seeing him, is confused. He steps up behind her. Then Richard starts dancing. They dance together: Olive in front, Richard backing her Richard looks at the Official with a defiant, fuck-you sm Sheryl, Frank and Dwayne, watching, can’t believe it.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Holy shit...!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Sheryl) You married that guy? Sheryl shakes her head -- she can’t believe it either. Frank runs down the aisle, jumps on stage, and dances nex Richard -- a surprisingly competent set of butt-wagging, party-music moves. Dwayne follows Frank up on stage. Sheryl pauses a moment and watches her family. Richard waves to Sheryl to join them. A beat. Then Sheryl walks, then runs, and jumps up on sta Richard helps her up, and they dance together. Kirby cranks it to “10”. MUSIC is overpowering everything As the songs winds up, Sheryl lines up next to Olive for unified series of thrusts. As the final cymbal crashes, Olive pulls up her shirt to reveal “Peach” is written on her tummy with magic marker. Audience MEMBERS respond with a standing ovation. Frank and Dwayne strut around with their arms in the air, like victorious professional wrestlers.  107. Richard picks up Olive, swings her in the air. Sheryl wal over and hugs Richard and Olive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, Sheryl, Olive, Frank, and Dwayne sit -- dazed -- office. They’re all handcuffed together, except Olive. Nothing’s happening. Flourescent lights HUM. Frank and Dwayne are still wearing their “LOSER” T-shirts Boxes of pageant materials -- trophies, sashes, tiaras -- stacked around them. Sheryl quietly eyes Richard, slouched next to her, and sm to herself. Her eyes drift to a nearby carton of tiaras. A door OPENS. They all look over. A COP appears, starts taking off their handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Okay. You’re out.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We‘re free?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: They're dropping charges. On the condition that you don’t enter your child in a beauty contest in the State of Florida ever again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I think we can live with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, Sheryl, Olive, Frank, and Dwayne step into the lobby. It’s deserted. Decorations and banners litter the floor. They wander out, dazed, rubbing their wrists. Sheryl approaches Richard, takes a tiara from behind her back, places it on his head. Richard accepts it wryly.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Great. Thank you very much.  108. She smiles. Richard turns to Olive with the tiara.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Here. I think this is for you.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: Dad...! She struggles to articulate something. Finally, she shrug OLIVE (cont‘d) I just like dancing.:.!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Well, you were great.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You were beyond great.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: You were incredible.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE
dialogues.text: (shy) Thank you. They all smile at her. Then Richard looks around.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Let‘s get the fuck out.of here...!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: SOUNDS of cars on a distant highway.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..S0 it’s two in the morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is seated at a picnic table at a road-side rest stop. Cars WHIZZ by on a highway in the far background. They've finished eating -~ an empty bucket of KFC and bot of Diet Sprite litter the table. Richard is telling a sto Everyone is relaxed -- smiling and listening.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: +..He’s down on his knees in this dumpster behind the racetrack... And it starts to rain. (laughter) It’s wet... It’s hot... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luy. RICHARD (cont'd) He’s crawling around in this garbage, cursing like a pirate -- looking for this ticket that I threw away -- and all of a sudden he goes, “Richard, don’t drop the light!” And I go, “Don’t what?” (mimes holding light) And he goes, “Drop the fucking light!!!" So I go... (mimes dropping light) Right in the water! He’s like... (mimes electric shock) Ahhhaahhhaahhhaahhhhhh! ! ! (appalled laughter) I run back, unplug the light, run to the dumpster ~- he’s lying there, rain is pouring down... And he’s got the ticket! This twelve hundred dollar trifecta ticket! And I’m like, “Dad! Dad, are you okay?” And he looks at me and all he says is: “Richard... Don’t ever have children.” Everyone bursts out laughing. RICHARD (cont’d) To me, he says that! To me! The mirth tapers off. They glance at each other. Frank holds up his bottle of Diet Sprite.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Here’s to Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Here’s to Grandpa. They clink and drink. Richard nods to a snack shack nearb

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So... Who wants some ice-cream? cuT TO BLACK
